Generate a 2D sketch on the XY plane with the following components: - Draw a circle (circle\\_1) for face\\_1, loop\\_1: - Center: [0.045, 0.045] - Radius: 0.045 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.09. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 5. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the final CAD part with the following properties: - Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.75 - Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Scaling parameter: 0.09 **Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered End** *Shape*: A cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube. *Dimensions*: - Height: 0.09 - Width: 0.09 - Length: 0.375 *Instructions*: 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.045, 0.0, -0.045] 2. Generate a 2D sketch on the XZ plane with the following components: - Draw a circle (circle\\_1) for face\\_1, loop\\_1: - Center: [0.045, 0.045] - Radius: 0.045 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.09. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 5. Instead of extruding the 3D sketch to generate the final CAD part directly, this time perform a boolean operation (cut) with the previous CAD model to achieve the desired shape. The cutting depth should be set to 0.375.</description>
